content.description: Climb the thin left face to the top.
content.location: This ascends the left (west) face of the free standing pinnacle.

content.description: Go up the right side of the Pinnacle face to the right of the old bolt studs. There are technical moves on a near vertical face. This is given 5.8 in the Boston RocksÂ guidebook. Bouldering this line feels like a technical V1.
content.location: Go to the Pinnacle/Eliminator area. Up the freestanding boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the massive jug. Climb straight up on good holds.
content.location: The climb starts on the left side of the east face, the one facing the Pinnacle Wall.

content.description: Climb the thin right (south) face to the top.
content.location: This is on the right (south) face of the free standing pinnacle.

content.description:
This is a boulder in the Pinnacle area.

 The Pinnacle and Eliminator Roof have a small set problems that are probably no more than 15 feet tall. This is a tiny area with a neat roof problem. While these are short rocks, a toprope is advisable until you have these wired, especially the Eliminator Roof.

 Pinnacle Boulder:

 A. West Face, 10, 1p, TR. B. Southwest Air, 8 or V1, 20'. C. South Face, 10, 1p, TR.

 The GPS coordinates are not correct yet.
